com.team1389.hardware.outputs.software

Class RangeOut<T extends Value>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team1389.hardware.outputs.software.RangeOut<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type that the doubles in the stream represent
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScalarInput<T>, java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Double>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AngleOut, PercentOut

    public class RangeOut<T extends Value>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScalarInput<T>
    a stream of doubles with a range, and methods to deal with conversion and range of the stream
    Author:
    Kenneth

        Parameters:

      • getWatchable

        public Watchable getWatchable(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - the string identifier of this stream
        Returns:
        a watchable object that tracks the value of this stream

      • addFollowers

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R addFollowers(RangeOut<T> outFollow)
        adds a stream as a follower; The stream will now be passed any value this stream recieves.

        If the follower stream has a different range than the leader stream, the input will be mapped to the follower's range before being passed

        Parameters:
        outFollow - stream to add as a follower
        Returns:
        this stream but with an additional follower

      • applyDeadband

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R applyDeadband(double deadband)
        causes the stream to replace the value of anything in the deadzone with 0.0
        Parameters:
        deadband - the max distance from 0 (deadzone)
        Returns:
        stream with Deadband of deadband

      • clamp

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R clamp()
        constrains values in the stream to be between min and max of this stream
        Returns:
        new stream that is limited to a range

      • limit

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R limit(double abs)
        clamps the stream within the range of [-abs , abs]
        Parameters:
        abs - the absolute value of min/max of range
        Returns:
        clamped stream

      • limit

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R limit(double min,
                                       double max)
        constrains values in the stream to be between min and max arguments
        Parameters:
        min - the min value of desired capped range
        max - the max value of desired capped range
        Returns:
        new stream that is limited to a range

      • offset

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R offset(ScalarInput<?> offsetAmt)
        Parameters:
        offsetAmt - the stream that holds the values which this stream is offset by
        Returns:
        this stream but with all the values offset by the value in the input stream

      • offset

        public <R extends RangeOut<T>> R offset(double amt)
        Parameters:
        amt - the value that is added to every value in this stream
        Returns:
        this stream but with amt added to every value

      • scale

        public RangeOut<T> scale(double factor)
        Parameters:
        factor - value to scale by
        Returns:
        this stream but with min, max, and val multiplied by factor

      • convertRange

        protected <N extends Value> RangeOut<N> convertRange()
        converts the stream to the desired value type
        Returns:
        a new stream with the same values but the new type

      • setRange

        public RangeOut<T> setRange(int min,
                            int max)
        sets the min and max values of the stream
        NOTE: Unlike mapToRange, this operation does not affect the values in the stream, only the range.
        Parameters:
        min - value to set as min
        max - value to set as max
        Returns:
        this stream but with a new min and max
